name.treatmentStandardsRoutes: annealed and pickled, grade 304, Austenitic, electric arc furnace route

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Good data quality. Data collected on site by steel industry experts in accordance with the worldsteel methodology and consistency-checked by ISSF and worldsteel LCA-experts. Carried out in accordance with ISO 14040 series. All models of electricity production per type of primary energy (e.g. coal extraction, transport and combustion in electricity power plant) were DEAM models (sources: ETH-Zuerich21 1996 and Electricit, de France 1996) and standard for all sites. Sensitivity analyses showed that the main inventory parameters can vary considerably due to electricity grid mix changes. DEAM transportation models were used to calculate the transportation inventories based on distance and type of transportation (truck, rail, sea, etc.) recorded in the questionnaires. Global raw material data used for Chromium, Nickel and Molybdenum. Other raw material data taken from existing databases. Nickel raw material data has been updated once since the original LCI collection. An update of the EU stainless steel LCI database is (2009) under consideration.

time.common:timeRepresentativenessDescription: Annual average, site-specific data for one year. New data collection anticipated for 2008 to take account of changes in production sites, technologies and to incorporate end of life recycling. Possible inclusion of revised upstream process data where available.

locationOfOperationSupplyOrProduction.descriptionOfRestrictions: Data set is cradle-to-gate data based on average site-specific data (gate-to-gate) of European steel producers. Electricity grid mix is European-average data. Other upstream data (e.g. chrome) are based on global averages.

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: Raw material extraction and processing, e.g. coal, chrome, nickel, steel scrap etc. Transport is also included, as well as transportation of scrap. Scrap processing was not included as there was no data available at the time. Electric Arc Furnace, Hot rolling, Annealing and Pickling. Product manufacturing route can be found in the Methodology Report.
technology.technologicalApplicability: The stainless steel product may be used in a wide range of industrial sectors including automotive, construction, packaging, chemicals plant and equipment, food and drinks preparation and storage, kitchen appliances and utensils.

LCIMethodAndAllocation.deviationsFromLCIMethodApproaches: Section 4 of the European LCI Database for Stainless Steel Products Methodology Report gives full details of allocation methodologies.
LCIMethodAndAllocation.modellingConstants: All data used in the calculation of the LCI results refer to net calorific value.

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.dataCutOffAndCompletenessPrinciples: Cut-off rules: It is estimated that, for the participating stainless steel producers, greater than 99% w/w of steel works material inputs and 100% of energy inputs has been recorded. The upstream production of these inputs has been taken into account for more than 95% w/w of these inputs. Wastes representing less than 1% of total waste tonnage for given process stages were not recorded unless treated outside of the site. All environmentally relevant emissions to air and water were included; soil emissions (and contaminated land) were outside the scope of the study. For more details see the European LCI Database for Stainless Steel Products Methodology Report and in particular section 5 and Appendix 9.
dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.dataSelectionAndCombinationPrinciples: Data on steel making unit processes was collected on site. Where data was missing for specific relevant flows it was necessary to provide an average value determined from those sites that had provided the data. Missing emission data had to be calculated from emission ratio (per kg of product or, for some air emissions, with fuel combustion ratio). LCI modelling is fully consistent.
dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.dataTreatmentAndExtrapolationsPrinciples: Where no data were available, upstream data (from the DEAM database) were utilised.
dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: The original data set did not include the burden and credit associated with the recycling of steel scrap during stainless steel production, manufacturing and End-of-Life. Subsequently, however, ISSF has developed a methodology, similar to that used by worldsteel for carbon steel, that can be used to give credit for recycling of stainless steel (equation: Xwith credit = Xprimary + (Xrecycled -Xprimary) * RR * Y (RR - recycling ration - = 0.8, Y = 1/1.10)). The data provided here includes the credits for recycling and an average end-of-life recycling rate of 80 % is assumed. For specific steel data set requests contact the European Confederation of Iron and Steel Industries, Eurofer (European data): www.eurofer.org and the International Stainless Steel Forum, ISSF (for Global data and further information about the approach to credits for recycling): www.worldstainless.org.

common:scope.name: LCI results or Partly terminated system
LCI results or Partly terminated system
LCI results or Partly terminated system

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: For details please see critical review report.; Documentation: For details please see critical review report; LCI Method: For details please see critical review report
review.common:otherReviewDetails: For details please see critical review report.

common:commissionerAndGoal.common:project: European LCI Database for Coiled Flat Stainless Steel Products
common:commissionerAndGoal.intendedApplications: To produce a cradle to gate LCI in line with ISO 14040 series, covering a part of the life cycle of coiled flat stainless steel products, from raw material extraction up to coiled flat stainless steel products ready to leave the manufacturing sites, without taking into account downstream manufacturing into general products, their use, end of life or scrap recovery schemes. To enable each stainless steel company involved in the study to perform an environmental benchmark of their products and processes. To provide reliable data to meet requests from customers and external studies. To quantify resources use, energy and environmental emissions associated with the processing of certain stainless steel products from the extraction of raw materials in the ground through to the steel factory gate.

common:referenceToPrecedingDataSetVersio.common:shortDescription: Stainless Steel Hot Rolled Coil; annealed and pickled, grade 304, Austenitic, electric arc furnace route; production mix, at plant; 18% chromium, 10% nickel

publicationAndOwnership.common:accessRestrictions: The data set can be used free of charge by anybody to perform LCA studies, to distribute it to third parties, to convert it to other formats, to develop own data sets etc. as long as the copyright and license conditions for the ELCD data sets and the ILCD format are met that can be accessed via http://lca.jrc.ec.europa.eu. Please note e.g. that reference must be given to the 'Owner of data set' and to the 'ELCD database' plus version number, when using the data set or parts thereof. Please note also, that any modifications/omissions of the data set results in invalidity of any existing 'Official approval of data set by producer/operator', that the impression must be avoided that this would still be a complete ELCD data set, and that the content of further fields has to be adjusted. For details see the aforementioned copyright and license conditions.
